html: Continuing their Song of Salvation (v 1 ), those at home welcome from abroad those of Jehovah’s people who “keep faith,” whose “minds are steadfast”—inferring that those who didn’t keep faith, whose minds weren’t steadfast, aren’t with them. Jehovah preserves his faithful people in perfect “peace”—a synonym of healing and salvation (Isaiah 52:7; 53:5; 57:19 )—while for the wicked “there is no peace” (Isaiah 48:18, 22; 57:21 ). Although to his elect Jehovah is a “Rock” of salvation (Isaiah 17:10; 30:29; 44:8 ), to the unrepentant he is a “stumbling block or obstructing rock ” (Isaiah 8:14 ; emphasis added).
